member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.IEplActionChecked.Checked(System.String,Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.ActionCallingContext)
member.summary: One action can have the state on off or mixed. Return 0 for off, 1 for on, and 2 for mixed.
member.remarks: This function is called often and should work fast.
member.returns: 0: The return action has the state unchecked. 1: The return action has the state checked. 2: The return action has the state mixed.

member.name: T:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.IEplActionChecked
member.summary: Interface to switch the status on / off of an Action. If this interface is not used, the Action is off by default. If you implement this interface in an action class, you can set the state of the respective Action to on. If 0, unchecks; if 1, checks; and if 2, sets indeterminate.

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.IEplActionEnable.Enabled(System.String,Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.ActionCallingContext)
member.summary: One action can be enabled or disabled. Return true when it is enabled.
member.remarks: This function is called often and should work performant.
member.returns: true: The return action is enabled.

member.name: T:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.IEplActionEnable
member.summary: Interface to enable or disable an Action. If this interface is not used, the Action is enabled by default. If you implement this interface in an action class, you can set the respective Action to disabled. If a tool bar button or menu item points to this Action, they will be also disabled (greyed out).

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.IEplAddIn.OnExit
member.summary: Is called at system shutdown if the add-in was loaded at system startup!

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.IEplAddIn.OnInitGui
member.summary: Called by the framework if the user interface was initialized and the add-in can modify the user interface. Is only called if the add-in is loaded at system startup!

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.IEplAddIn.OnInit
member.summary: Is called if the add-in is to be loaded at system start-up .

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.IEplAddIn.OnUnregister
member.summary: Is called once, when the add-in is removed from the system.

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.IEplAddIn.OnRegister(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Is called once when a new add-in is selected.
member.param: true: The module is loaded at system startup and OnInit() is called.
member.returns: true, if the add-in was successfully loaded and registered.
member.remarks:
When this function returns false, the add-in is not added to the system. At next start of EPLAN the add-in is not loaded.
If bLoadOnStart is set to false, the API add-in assembly is registered but not loaded automatically on the next startup of EPLAN. Still all actions registered with the add-in are known in EPLAN and the addin will be loaded once one of the actions is executed. Please mind, that in this case OnInitGui(), etc. is only called, when the dll is loaded, so normal menu items from the add-in are not created, when EPLAN starts.

member.name: T:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.IEplAddIn
member.summary: Interface declaration for an EPLAN add-in. If an assembly is to be loaded as an EPLAN add-in, exactly one class of the assembly must implement this interface.

member.name: T:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.IEplAction

member.remarks: Action names with . are not allowed.

member.name: T:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.EnableCondition
member.summary: To enable or disable a menu item via API you can use the internal menu conditions. Menu conditions are not so detailed as an own of the action but of high performance. You should use the internal menu conditions where ever it is possible.
member.remarks: The menu condition is a string. The condition has to be signed as an attribute above the action implementation. Inside the string you can combine several menu conditions with the 'or'(||) or 'and' of C++, but it is not allowed to mix 'or' and 'and' up to now. In addition you can negotiate a menu condition with !.

you can get a list of all implemented menu conditions, if you search in all *.h files of our internal source code for the interface "IMfEnableDisableMenue"; you will find the most of them in layer "GedFramework"
member.param: the string which contains the menu condition or a combination of them

member.summary: Used to mark a function of a class in a script if the function of this script is to be registered as an in the system.
member.param: The function is saved with this name as an in the system.

member.name: T:Eplan.EplApi.Scripting.DeclareAction
member.summary: Attribute used to mark a method of a class in a so that this method will be registered as an in the system. If a method, which is marked by the DeclareAction attribute has string parameters, these \parameters will be recognized as parameters of the Action.

member.name: T:Eplan.EplApi.Scripting.Start
member.summary: Used to mark a function of a class in a . Once the script is run, this function is called. This function may also have .

member.name: P:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.Action.ActionProperties
member.summary: Descriptive data for this action.

member.name: P:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.Action.ModuleName
member.summary: Name of the module in which this action is implemented.

member.name: P:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.Action.Name
member.summary: Name used to identify this action in the system.

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.Action.Execute(Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.ActionCallingContext)
member.summary: Performs the actual action.
member.param: Using this parameter generic parameters of variable number and different types can be passed to the action.
member.returns: true: This function was completed successfully. false: An error occurred while performing the action.
member.remarks: Exceptions, which occur during the execution of an action can be retrieved from the ActionCallingContext by the GetException() method.
member.exception: Exceptions may occur while performing the action. All these exceptions are returned as BaseException.

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.Action.#ctor(AfAction*)
member.summary: For internal use only.

member.name: T:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.Action
member.summary: An action performs a task in the system. It is usually called via menu items or the . \Parameters can be passed to the action in a context class, and return values can be obtained with this parameter. Actions are implemented in an add-in by deriving a class from .
member.remarks:
Actions are registered under a name in the system. Using this name, you can find an action and call its execution function .
Please mind, that Microsoft.Net framework 3.5 contains a class System.Action. If you include the namespace Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework in your code file by e.g. a using statement without the use of an alias, you might get a compiler error like: "'Action' is an ambiguous reference between 'System.Action' and 'Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.Action'". Action names with . are not allowed.

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.AfLockingSetHandleVector.EndLockingStep(System.Int32!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsLong)
member.summary: Ends a locking step identified by nLockingStepId. ManualLocking mode is set to its previous value; Original locking state is restored. Use LockingStep object to create and dispose locking steps.

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.AfLockingSetHandleVector.StartLockingStep
member.summary: Starts a locking step. ManualLocking mode is set to ON; Gets the position in LockingVector (in order to restore locking state when LockingStep is disposed). Use LockingStep object to create and dispose locking steps.
member.returns: Locking step identifier.

member.name: T:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.ActionCallingContext
member.summary: This is the ActionCallingContext class used to pass \parameters to an action and to receive return values of the action.
member.remarks:
Using AddParameter(...) you can add explicitly named \parameters to ActionCallingContext. The action must use this explicit name to reference these parameters. Likewise, values returned by the action can be added.
Please mind, that an Action may modify the ActionCallingContext dureing its execution. Sometimes e.g. project Ids are added to the context and are passed to an inner action. Re-using the same ActionCallingContext for a further Action call may lead to unexpected results. So in most cases, it is advisable to create a new ActionCallingContext for a new Action call.

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.IActionCallingContext.SetToolTipString(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the tooltip string of the associated menu item or toolbar button.

member.name: T:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.IActionCallingContext
member.summary: Interface class for the class. Can be used instead of the class in function parameters.

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.UserRights.GetCategories
member.summary: \returns the full names of all existing user rights categories.
member.returns: the full category names in a string collection. The names are needed in order to add a new right to an existing category.

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.UserRights.DeleteRight(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the specified right entry from the UserRights database (rights management dialog)
member.param: name of the user right entry to remove
member.returns: true, in case the right was successfully removed from the rights management database.
member.remarks: The currently logged-in user must have the URShowAdministrationDialog right, this is the right to work on user rights. Any group assignments of this right are removed.

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.UserRights.AddRight(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the specified right entry to the given category of the custom UserRights file. The new right name will appear in the rights management dialog.
member.param: category name string. Only existing categories can be used. You can get the existing categories by the GetCategories method. You need to set the complete category name, you find in the StringCollection returned by GetCategory.
member.returns: true, in case the new right was successfully added to the rights management database.
member.remarks: The currently logged-in user must have the URShowAdministrationDialog right, this is the right to work on user rights. The custom user rights will be saved to the file "$(EPLAN_DATA)\\Administration\\customrights.erm". The system administrator needs to protect this file from changes by unauthorized persons.
member.exception: Thrown when logged-in user has not enough right to work on user rights.
Thrown when given right strRightname already exist.
Thrown when category strCategory does not exist.

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.UserRights.GetGroups(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the groups from user rights management, to which the specified user belongs..
member.returns: The groups, the user belongs to.

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.UserRights.SetUser(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the user.
member.returns: True: User was changed. False: User was not changed.

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.UserRights.GetUser
member.summary: Gets the user.
member.returns: The user.

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.UserRights.CheckRightFor(System.String)
member.summary: Checks the execute permission of an action
member.param: Name of the execute permission to be checked.
member.returns: true: Action is granted execute permission. false: The action must not be executed by the current user.
member.remarks:
Before executing newly programmed functions, the API programmer should check a right that is relatively similar to that of the new function. If, for example, a function is implemented that generates new pages, the right to create pages (XGedNewSchemePage) should be queried beforehand.
If you check for a right, which is not yet added to the UserRights database, this right is always granted.

member.name: M:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.UserRights.CheckUserRights
member.summary: Queries, whether the rights management is currently active.
member.returns: true: Rights management activated in the system; false: No rights management activated in the system.
member.remarks: This method does not change the current mode of rights management. It only checks, whether the rights management is active or not.

member.name: T:Eplan.EplApi.ApplicationFramework.UserRights
member.summary: Class for checking execute permissions. In the rights management module, you can assign execute permissions to individual actions. These execute permissions are also assigned to specific users. As a result, the rights management system can decide whether the logged-on user has the right to perform a specific action. The rights management system can be completely disabled , or it can be set to a specific operating mode (logging on with the current windows user). However, this operating mode cannot be queried or set via API.
